intro: Drepananthus obtusifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf drepananthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
